sources.title: Stop Using Your Keyboard and Start Using This Simple, Free Speech-to-Text App
sources.snippet: The article introduces Handy, a free and user-friendly speech-to-text application designed to make advanced voice transcription accessible to everyone. Developed by CJ Pais after an injury that prevented him from typing, Handy simplifies the use of powerful open-source AI speech-to-text models like Nvidia‚Äôs Parakeet and OpenAI‚Äôs Whisper by offering a one-click setup and easy keyboard shortcut activation. Available for Windows, macOS, and Linux, Handy lets users speak naturally while their words are transcribed directly into any text field. The app supports multiple languages, is resilient to background noise like music, and includes optional customizations for shortcuts, microphones, audio feedback, and startup behavior. Though it includes advanced options for tech-savvy users, Handy is designed for simplicity, ensuring minimal setup or maintenance. It stands out as a distraction-free, no-cost solution in a market often filled with subscription-based AI tools. Ideal for those seeking an alternative to typing‚Äîwhether due to accessibility needs or preference‚ÄîHandy delivers on the long-promised futuristic convenience of voice-controlled computing.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Handy (free AI-powered app) Wraps open-source models like Whisper into a simple desktop app. WIRED
üõ† Developer / Embedded Options OpenAI Whisper (open-source model) ‚Äì high accuracy, offline capable (via 3rd-party tools/app wrappers). Gladia
MirrorFly API ‚Äì customizable speech recognition pipelines for apps. Apphitect
